comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: "The Sherwood Foresters and Worcestershire and Sherwood Foresters Regimental War Memorial, known as Crich Stand is probably Derbyshire's most famous landmark. Access is allowed to the public and on a clear day it is possible to see seven counties - Lincoln to the East and the Wrekin to the West. " en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crich "Built in 1923 on the site of an older tower called Crich Stand, the Memorial Tower is the destination of an annual pilgrimage on the first Sunday in July. It is 1,000 feet (300 m) above sea level, and has 52 steps to the top. From there eight counties can be seen, including landmarks such as the Humber Bridge and Lincoln Cathedral." So it is the older tower in the photochrom.
